medical_history.chief_complaint: Lower extremity bowing in a 4-year-old girl.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 19 months of age with lower extremity bowing. The patient underwent fasting blood and urine tests which revealed normal renal function and signs of rickets, leading to treatment that resulted in significant radiological improvement after 12 months.

past_medical_history.proband: Probands's father had a history of hypophosphatemic rickets/osteomalacia and underwent osteotomy due to severe lower limb deformities.

medical_history.family_history: The elder daughter and father were affected by hypophosphatemic rickets, while the younger sister was presumed unaffected. Family history suggests genetic transmission occurred as an X-linked dominant trait.
